      • initializeLogging

        public static void initializeLogging()
                              throws IOException
        Initializes our static logger, pulling the logs directory from the "log-path" pref. Henceforth, logger will be ready for action.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getActionName

        public static String getActionName(String name)
        Return a potentially translated representation of name to be used as action names.
        Parameters:
        name - canonical action name
        Returns:
        version of name to be shown to the user.

      • installActionNameTranslations

        public static void installActionNameTranslations(Path p)
        Installs action name translations from a JSON file. The JSON data should be an object, whose names are the canonical action names ("Look", etc.) and the values the translated names. An example: 
        {
    "Look" : "Espy",
    "Wait" : "Tarry"
 }
        Parameters:
        p - path to JSON file

      • installActionNameTranslations

        public static void installActionNameTranslations(Map<String,String> m)
        Installs action name translations from a Map.
        See Also:
        installActionNameTranslations(Path)

      • loadActionNameTranslations

        public static Map<String,String> loadActionNameTranslations(Path p)
        Loads and returns an action name translation map from a JSON file.
        Parameters:
        p - path to JSON file
        Returns:
        translation map
        See Also:
        installActionNameTranslations(Path)

      • resetActionNameTranslations

        public static void resetActionNameTranslations()
        Remove any game-specific action name translations, and retain only the system translations.

      • setAssetsPath

        public static void setAssetsPath(Path assetsPath)
        Sets the base assets path against which the system and game assets paths will be resolved.
        Parameters:
        assetsPath -

      • setSystemAssetsPath

        public static void setSystemAssetsPath(String path)
        Sets the system assets path. This can be a directory or a ZIP file.
        Parameters:
        path - path, relative to assetsPath

      • setGameAssetsPath

        public static void setGameAssetsPath(String path)
        Sets the game assets path. This can be a directory or a ZIP file.
        Parameters:
        path - path, relative to assetsPath

      • pathForGameAsset

        public static Path pathForGameAsset(String asset)
        Returns a Path representing the given asset, resolved against the game assets path.
        Parameters:
        asset - path (relative to the game assets path) of the asset we want
        Returns:
        the resolved path

      • pathForSystemAsset

        public static Path pathForSystemAsset(String asset)
        Returns a Path representing the given asset, resolved against the system assets path.

        This method is for the Meterman system classes only: games should call pathForGameAsset(String) instead.

        Parameters:
        asset - (relative to the system assets path) of the asset we want
        Returns:
        the resolved path

      • parseBoolean

        public static boolean parseBoolean(String s)
        Examines a String to determine if it's a way to say "true"
        Parameters:
        s - if this is "true", "on", "1", or "yes" then we consider it true
        Returns:
        truth value of s

      • parseInt

        public static int parseInt(String s,
           int errorVal)
        Parses an input string as a decimal integer
        Parameters:
        s - String representation of an integer
        errorVal - if s is not successfully parsed, we return this value
        Returns:
        int value of s if parseable, or errorVal otherwise

      • parseFloat

        public static float parseFloat(String s,
               float errorVal)
        Parses an input string as a float
        Parameters:
        s - String representation of a float
        errorVal - if s is not successfully parsed, we return this value
        Returns:
        float value of s if parseable, or errorVal otherwise

      • parseDouble

        public static double parseDouble(String s,
                 double errorVal)
        Parses an input string as a double
        Parameters:
        s - String representation of a double
        errorVal - if s is not successfully parsed, we return this value
        Returns:
        double value of s if parseable, or errorVal otherwise

      • parseInt

        public static int parseInt(String s)
        Equivalent to parseInt(s, 0)

      • clamp

        public static int clamp(int i,
        int min,
        int max)
        Ensures an input int i is between [min, max] (inclusive on both ends).

      • fmt

        public static String fmt(String s,
         Object... args)
        Equivalent to String.format(s, args)

      • booleanPref

        public static boolean booleanPref(String key,
                  boolean defaultVal)
        Returns the boolean value of a preference. If the key doesn't exist, it will be created and set to defaultVal.
        Parameters:
        key - preference key
        defaultVal - default value
        Returns:
        value of the preference, or defaultVal if it doesn't exist.

      • intPref

        public static int intPref(String key,
          int defaultVal)
        Returns the int value of a preference. If the key doesn't exist, it will be created and set to defaultVal. If the value of the preference cannot be parsed as an int, we return defaultVal.
        Parameters:
        key - preference key
        defaultVal - default value
        Returns:
        value of the preference, or defaultVal if it doesn't exist.

      • floatPref

        public static float floatPref(String key,
              float defaultVal)
        Returns the float value of a preference. If the key doesn't exist, it will be created and set to defaultVal. If the value of the preference cannot be parsed as a float, we return defaultVal.
        Parameters:
        key - preference key
        defaultVal - default value
        Returns:
        value of the preference, or defaultVal if it doesn't exist.

      • pref

        public static String pref(String key,
          String defaultVal)
        Returns the String value of a preference. If the key doesn't exist, it will be created and set to defaultVal.
        Parameters:
        key - preference key
        defaultVal - default value
        Returns:
        value of the preference, or defaultVal if it doesn't exist.

      • getPref

        public static String getPref(String key)
        Facade for Properties.getProperty(java.lang.String)

      • setPref

        public static void setPref(String key,
           String value)
        Facade for Properties.setProperty(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      • sleep

        public static void sleep(long millis)
        Causes the current thread to sleep for millis milliseconds, catching InterruptedException and re-setting the thread interrupted flag.

      • randInt

        public static int randInt(int min,
          int max)
        Returns a random int between min and max, inclusive.

      • slurpReaderText

        public static String slurpReaderText(Reader r,
                     int bufferSize)
        Read all characters available from a Reader and return them as a string. We use a BufferedReader internally to make the process more efficient.
        Parameters:
        r - Reader from which to read characters
        bufferSize - buffer size for our BufferedReader
        Returns:
        String read from the reader, or null if an exception occurred

      • getStringResource

        public static String getStringResource(String resourcePath)
        Loads a ClassLoader text resource and returns its contents as a String, assuming a UTF-8 encoding.
        Parameters:
        resourcePath - class-loader resource path, relative to Utils.class
        Returns:
        String value of resource, or an empty string on error
